channel.title: [PI] Client Won't Run
channel.description:
[CODE]PkOwnage is loading.. java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\hybridpvpnetcache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:76) at client.startUp(client.java:8457) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5752) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://hybridpvp.net/cache.zip at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Sou rce) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$6.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getChainedException(Unkno wn Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:109) at Update.<init>(Update.java:27) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4467) at client.startUp(client.java:8467) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5752) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://hybridpvp.net/cache.zip at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(Unknown So urce) at java.net.URLConnection.getHeaderFieldInt(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength(Unknown Source) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:104) ... 6 more error [/CODE]
I don't even really understand what's going wrong, I think it's something to do with a webclient being implemented or something, but I've never used webclients with my clients..
Will +Rep to whomever helps. <3

item.title: [PI] Client Won't Run
item.dc:creator: @noobicus noobicus
item.description:
@noobicus wrote:

[quote=“dan v jad, post:3, topic:414908”]Thanks a bunch, I didn’t expect to get this stuck after leaving rsps for 2 years >_<

although I don’t see why the map config is missing, but I’ll get another one and see what happens

as for the website cache, do i even really need it? All my old clients were just self extracting and everything was in the files… No need for “downloading a cache from the website”[/quote]
Well as scape owner said, it makes client downloads smaller, + if your planning on making a webclient I’d leave it like that, and if you want, you could just change the directory in signlink to read it from the client folders main directory.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client Won't Run
item.dc:creator: @sex-scape_owner sex-scape owner
item.description:
@sex-scape_owner wrote:

downloading the cache from a website makes the initial download very small and when you first run the client it downloads the cache for them so they dont have to put it in c:

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client Won't Run
item.dc:creator: @dan_v_jad dan v jad
item.description:
@dan_v_jad wrote:

Thanks a bunch, I didn’t expect to get this stuck after leaving rsps for 2 years >_<

although I don’t see why the map config is missing, but I’ll get another one and see what happens

as for the website cache, do i even really need it? All my old clients were just self extracting and everything was in the files… No need for “downloading a cache from the website”

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client Won't Run
item.dc:creator: @noobicus noobicus
item.description:
@noobicus wrote:

Well for one it says the map config is missing, i guess you could just take that from another cache… well actually…

Its saying that i guess it wants to download the cache from that link… (http://hybridpvp.net/cache.zip) but the file isnt there… which means you would have to modify the website and website directory the cache is downloaded from so it can properly download the cache… that is if you have it already… if not try and find it on google or something.

Read full topic
